author: gballet
content: The keys and values are always. 32 bytes _in the tree_. When it's in the proof, the keys are always 32 bytes but the values are either 32 bytes (if the value is present) or 0 bytes (if the value is absent)

author: gballet
content: If I may suggest a first thing that is easier to implement than a sync to condrieu - and very useful to the effort , it'd be to use erigon to do the conversion from MPT to verkle and produce a result that can be used by erigon but also other clients to sync from.

author: sky.cactus
content: For a bit of clarity to those following along, "Some people are hoping to get verkle trees into Cancun".  We don't even know what is going into Shanghai yet, so claiming to know what will go into Cancun seems like quite a stretch of reality to me.

author: gballet
content: The question was whether Cancun was a testnet, it's not, it's a fork. To clarify the clarification: Verkle trees are currently expected to land in Cancun, and are on track to be ready for that. If we hit a speed bump along the way, it will be pushed back but it is no "strech of reality" to claim they will at this stage.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think that is still too optimistic of a statement.  Verkle trees *spec* may be ready by Cancun, but that is often unrelated to whether something actually makes it into a network upgrade.  BLS, for example, has been ready for like 3 years or something, but it keeps getting bumped in favor of other things.

author: gballet
content: thank you for sharing your opinion, let's resume that conversation when Shanghai happens. In the meantime and to answer the original question, Cancun will remain the target fork block in the go code.
